description: The round payoff this round was 98. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 49.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) maximizes individual and total payoffs
The game is a coordination game with two Nash equilibria: mutual cooperation (option 1) and mutual defection (option 2), where cooperation yields superior outcomes
There is no incentive to unilaterally defect (choose option 2) when the other cooperates, as it results in a lower payoff than mutual cooperation
Repeated interactions incentivize sustaining cooperation to avoid suboptimal equilibria, as actions are revealed each round
